org.gearvrf

Class GVRPostEffect

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRPostEffect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRShaders
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRConsole

    public class GVRPostEffect
extends GVRHybridObject
implements GVRShaders
    A "post effect" shader is a shader which can be inserted into the pipeline between rendering the scene graph and applying lens distortion. A GVRPostEffect combines the id of a post effect shader with shader data: you can, for example, apply the same shader to each eye, using different parameters for each eye. It is actually quite similar to GVRMaterial.

      • setMainTexture

        public void setMainTexture(java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> texture)
        Description copied from interface: GVRShaders
        Asynchronously bind a different texture to the main_texture shader uniform. Uses a background thread from the thread pool to wait for the Future.get() method; unless you are loading dozens of textures asynchronously, the extra overhead should be modest compared to the cost of loading a texture.
        Specified by:
        setMainTexture in interface GVRShaders
        Parameters:
        texture - A future texture, from one of the the GVRAssetLoader.loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource) methods
